reviews.review:
Dota 2 is Valve's MOBA title, which is to say it's a real-time strategy game where you literally play the one single map over and over again, but you play as one of 700 characters that in other RTS games would be lategame units or lynchpins of a player's entire army, individual games can take hours, and there's a shop/inventory system for some reason. As a couple of my friends put it, half the features are bugs that got left in because the dev liked them; it's a horrifying mess with a skill floor that starts where other games have a ceiling, and a skill ceiling that may or may not exist.

(Also, the lore depicts the battle represented in the game as a final cataclysm between good and evil that will destroy the world no matter who wins, which is amusing to think about considering how many times it's been played out by the game's millions of fans.)

Taken altogether, Dota 2 seems very much like a product of people who got so incredibly attached to one very particular experience that they built everything else around it - and this is the important part - warts and all. People apparently spend massive amounts of time and money on what is essentially a glorified Warcraft III mod that itself has many mods, though, so it at least proves the viability of game modding.

This is also the product that's mainly responsible for killing the old Valve, the one that produced quality games on a semi-regular basis. Thanks to the massive popularity of Dota, and to an extent Counter-Strike: Global Offensive, Valve was content to sit on their butts iterating on them while screwing around with VR and reaping that store/market/microtransaction money for an entire decade before they managed to stop pretending the franchise that made them didn't exist and release Half-Life: Alyx.

I at least liked the snazzy main menu and the Half-Life 2 doot noises. Inclusion of the Counter-Strike AWP firing noise on the other hand just bewildered me.

Dota la reputamadre estoy muy enojado ya que no se que mierda se pasan por la cabeza ese gordo de Valve hijo de puta no se por donde se le ocurre quitarnos tanto mmr en un dota de 20 min y despues cuadno ganamos un de 2 horas nos dan 15 por favor fijense esta mierda por que ya me tiene hasta los huevos . atentamente jugador 8k GG pe ratas mierda carajo pene ( perdi 25 de mmr en un dota de 20 minutos con team de peruanos feeder color magnus y en el otro era EG en sus tiempos victoriosos ) Valve desbanea a mi Dios el gordito guapo negro mas sabroso Smash que tiene que alimentar a sus 24 hijos puneños chau

Esse jogo me prendeu tanto desde o começo de uma forma inexplicável, mesmo com todas as difículdades. Quem joga de verdade Dota 2, sabe que mesmo jogando mais de 1.000 horas, ainda assim você não consegue aprender TUDO, é preciso muito tempo para se saber jogar de verdade e em equipe! Mesmo que você ache que jogue bem, sempre vai ter uma dúvida aqui ou ali. Eu por exemplo, já chamei VÁRIOS amigos para jogarem e é difícil alguém continuar jogando, pois precisa ter uma mente muito aberta para conseguir entrar no jogo, mas não quero dizer entrar de apenas abrir o dota e ficar jogando por horas sem entender nada, eu quero dizer conseguir entrar no personagem e viver tudo aquilo!

Mesmo dota tendo uma comunidade um pouco tóxica, ainda vão ter aqueles que se enforçam para te ajudar. Um desses é o meu duo que me ajudou desde o começo e que está comigo até agora. Dota também é muito bom em unir pessoas e para te ensinar a fazer as coisas em equipe, pois, dota sempre foi um jogo único e que sem trabalho em grupo você nunca vai conseguir ganhar uma partida, e esse é o bom do jogo!

me apaixonei desde a primeira partida, dota 2 consegue te deixar triste, feliz, nervoso, concentrado em fim, consegue te porporcionar uma explosão de sentimentos durante uma partida, mas por ser um jogo complexo é necessário várias horas de jogo e de adaptação, vc precisa realmente estar disposto a aprender e jogar com os amigos é o melhor. Conheci minha duo jogando e ao lado dela ficou tudo mais divertido, crescemos no jogo juntos e as horas de diversão nesse game vou levar pra vida toda.

Realmente Este é um jogo otimo em varios aspectos , serio muitos mesmo entao com absoluta certeza... Este é um moba de cair o queixo, algo simplesmente inpresionante e que vale a pena gastar varias horas.

DEMAIS BIXO VLW FLW

jogo de moba que requer muita atencao e estrategia dos players....extremamente viciante com uma classe gigantesca de herois,varias combos com magias itens  e equip...quem realmente gosta de um jogo de qualidade recomendo dota...por ser publico tem alguns players indesejaveis

Я прошел долгий путь с этой игрой. А это где-то 6000 часов игры. Это приблизительно 8 месяцев безостановочной игры. Да за это время можно выучить английский до уровня pre-intermediate или выше...
Стать сис. админом начального уровня, или написать свой первый проект по программированию (игру к примеру).

Все это говорит, что игра чем то цепляет. Разнообразие героев, скилов, предметов, игроков, механик, регулярные обновления. Ну и куда же без всяких "Шапок", скинов, насмешек и прочей лабуды фан сервиса.
Она еще и киберспортивная (чем бы корова не тешилась, лишь бы извлечь выгоду из воздуха).

Те кто сомневается попробовать в неё - берегитесь негласного "контракта с дьяволом" после нажатия кнопки "запустить катку". Ваш ангел шепчет вам за спиной - дозировка залог успеха или "удалить игру".

Длительное пребывание за этой игрой вырабатывает нервозность, раздражительность на любые мелочи. Может расшатать психику или ослабить механизмы защиты. Сила воли не безгранична.

Dota 2 is one of those games that can be really fun to play sometimes, but outright aggravating at others. There are matches you will win because a couple team members are really good, there are some matches you will win because you're on fire, there are matches you will lose despite knowing the mechanisms of the game and your team members not doing so.  There are matches you will likely lose because others are frustrated, don't agree, or don't ward for vision. The smallest mistake or movement can decide a fight and in turn the match. While there are times that I really like this game and enjoy it there are equal amount of times that it frustrates me. The game is set up in such a way that you will typically be matched with people your play level. That means about 50% of the time you will win or lose unless there is fundamental improvement in your game play understanding and style. If you can't deal with losing sometimes then this game is definitely not for you. With that noted, a lot of time has been put in by developers to balance characters and keep the game fun and unique. I would give it a neutral and sometimes a positive rating depending on my experience.
EL DOTA SE ME DESINSTALA DE LA NADA

Nachdem ich nun lange ein treuer Dota Spieler und Fan bin hier meine review. Die bezieht sich vorallem auf den neuen Patch 7.0. Ich sags ungern aber das war der größte Müll den Valve jemals gemacht hat. Mit Patch 6.87 war alles gut gebalanct. Jeder Hero war spielbar, die Herosetups waren fast alle kompitabel gelungenes Game und das auch noch f2p und nicht p2w. Jetzt dauert es wieder Jahre bis alles seine Balance findet. Zudem sollten sich alle Spieleentwickler gehörig an der Nase fassen. Jedes spiel ist mit russischen Mitspielern überflutet, dies liegt an den Serverstandorten. Aber ein Spiel wie Dota2 das Geld in hülle und fülle umsetzt, obwohl es f2p ist kann sich locker leisten mehr Sever aufzustellen. Das Problem an meinen russischen Mitspieler wäre nicht, dass sie nichts sagen, aber sie akzeptieren einfach kein Englisch oder koennen dies auch nicht. Tut mal was für die Community!!!

This game is way to difficult and stressful for new players. I've been playing MOBA's for 2 years and this one is just too much. Ein Spiel das mit dem alten Klassiker kaum mehr zu vergleichen ist. Die Community hat sich leider auch nicht verbessert und so bleibt flame und trolling an der Tagesordnung, leider wird dafür viel zu wenig getan, ein undurchsichtiges Meldeverfahren soll die Spielqualität verbessern, tut dies allerdings gar nicht. Ganz davon abgesehen hilft der chat eher russische Schimpfwörter zu lernen den Kommunikation zu pflegen.
